author: cnbc.com
title: remains close to late-2014 highs as ongoing cuts reduce inventories
text:
inventories@
* Brent, WTI this week reached highest levels since November, 2014
* Tighter crude market feeding into refined products
* Rising U.S. production is one of few factors holding crude back
SINGAPORE, April 20 (Reuters) - Oil prices were   drawn down excess supplies.
Brent crude oil futures were at $73.69 per barrel at 0129 GMT, down 9 cents   down 7 cents at $68.22 a barrel.
 
As a result of a gradually tightening market, both Brent and WTI hit their highest levels since November, 2014 earlier this week, at $74.75 and $69.56 per barrel respectively.
The  
 
One of the factors that has somewhat held back prices from rising even further has been rising U.S. production <C-OUT-T-EIA>,   (Reporting by Henning Gloystein Editing by Joseph Radford)
